channel.description:
[quote="no-reply@squarespace.com"] Name: Tjaart Lehmacher
Email Address: tjaart@helpingbrands.care
Subject: Custom coding assistance with a Squarespace site required, please
Message: Caue,
As you can see from this email's subject I'm in need of some custom CSS support and here's hoping you will be able to come to my aid.
I have chosen the Wexley template for my Squarespace site and there's a couple of changes I would like to make on this template however I don't have ANY coding experience whatsoever. I've asked the following question on the Squarespace Answers forum with no luck so far and I'm amazed that no one their can support me with this because I don't feel that this one change presents itself as a worthy challenge for someone to resolve with CSS knowledge.
Anyway, here's the one question:
How do I disable the lightbox slideshow feature in the Wexley template's gallery grid with custom CSS?
In other words one would NOT be able to click on any image (b/w teen photos) in the gallery grid (to open a lightbox slideshow) I want the images on the home page's gallery to display as is in the grid only without them being clickable – I want the images to display-only WITHOUT the clickthrough to the lightbox.
My site's URL (which is still a work-in-progress): helpingbrands.care
On the forum I was able to find some code suggestions similar to my predicament which I had to customise somewhat to fit my site however with no coding knowledge, no luck was on the horizon. Have a look at:
http://answers.squarespace.com/questions/70489/remove-the-gallery-links-in-a-summary-block
And:
http://answers.squarespace.com/questions/35218/disable-grid-views-lightbox
Anyway, here's hoping you can help me.
With optimism. Tjaart L.
PS. There could be more custom CSS I might require with this site and I have no problem remunerating you for your time.
(Sent via cregox <http://www.cregox.com> ) [/quote]

item.dc:creator: @cregox Caue Rego
item.description:
@cregox wrote:

You should try it then.

For any code you try, worst case that can happen is you add the code, something gets broken, you remove the code. Probably nothing will happen, though. As for the code in this page, I can guarantee you it can not break anything.

But, from what I can see, I don't think it will work without customizing it for your page indeed. Here's my shot at it:

div.summary-block-collection-type-gallery div.summary-item-list div.summary-item {
  cursor: default;
  pointer-events: none;
}

You see, finding out that specific set of CSS rules, the selectors, for your page, is just about learning how to use the very basic things of Inspector, in (almost) any desktop browser.

Here's a how to for that, which I found on first hit from google inspector how to find css selector:

dailypost.wordpress.com

An Intro to CSS: Finding CSS Selectors

If that works for you, lucky you I got it on the first shot (like I did for @tjaart)

item.title: Remove any image click / link / lightbox from gallery page
item.dc:creator: @cregox Caue Rego
item.description:
@cregox wrote:

You're right, it is quite simple indeed.

Here's how I've solved it in a few minutes:

Googled for "css disable click" and found:

stackoverflow.com

Disable a link using css

asked by RSK on 04:55AM - 19 Jan 10
html, css

Which basically confirms your second link's idea. I don't like how he solved it using collection ID though, that doesn't seem right.

Then use Inspector to find where's the click event on your page. Can't really teach this in a few lines, although I could have gone finding a link for you about it (short time right now).

Finally make a very specific CSS to it, and there's no need of !important:

body.collection-type-gallery section#page div.thumb-list span.thumb {
  cursor: default;
  pointer-events: none;
}

Since you've mentioned "remunerating" and if this did help you, I do appreciate any contributions.
